captions.text: Welcome to the League of Legends Champion spot… haha I’m just kidding. It’s not a spotlight.
But we do have an epic game here. You see we got Kayle on one team, Morgana on the other, so no one’s gonna die cuz you just have bubbles.
But anyway Morgana running dodge seals instead of mana cuz she’s good at this game. Kayle missing some attacks but really shouldn’t matter.
Somehow she has green Dark Bindings though and somehow they have no cooldown. So, this was a pretty balanced patch I think.
And wow, Kayle somehow changing her skin mid-game, now that is a unique talent. I want that for a passive!
And Morgana clearly experiencing Riot Point envy as she’s got just the default skin and does not have that ability.
But putting her sword into the ground is such a great idea as gets ganked by Nasus; the summoner has no map awareness whatsoever. I just don’t understand that.
But Ryze of course feeling so good about one-shotting minions with Spell Flux, must have a ton of ability power there.
And running across the map, meeting up with Alistar so that they can run together, using the buddy system to cross that bridge because safety in numbers is the right way to go
But at this blue turret we see Cho’Gath defeating minions properly and just nomming them away, but getting stunned by that tower and shaking it off
But it’s Malady Monday guys: Look at that attack speed, he’s doing just so well with that, and he teammates must be raging so hard just the same.
So there’s that Head-butt getting him out of the way and Ryze turning on Ghost so he can run faster as all pros do, wasting the summoner spells with no combat going on at all. Great play.
And well he does come across Master Yi who is now locked into a duel with Katarina. Now both players of course six phantom dancers
And let me just talk about those phantom dancers. Man they’re such great big items. I love them.
So, moving on, as Kayle does a backflip. And by Kayle of course I mean Katarina.
Ashe baiting her team in the brush as all carries should do, never taking damage whatsoever.
Warwick comes in to tag out Katarina, letting her take that break right there and continuing to fail epicly hard against Master Yi’s dodge stats.
But Ryze running across the map, coming in to tag out Yi? No, he’s actually going to use Summoner Throw, that’s a new one!
Throws Yi across the map, charges up for Warwick, and BAM there’s the one-shot from Summoner Throw from full health. I think that’s pretty imbalanced, I’ll make sure we nerf that next patch.
But Kayle getting just knocked around by Nasus, taking a lot of damage. Morgana taking great pleasure in that conflict.
Nasus grouping up for his last fight and oh no, Ryze has shown up finally Rune Prison and Overload knocking the teammates away.
And here comes the amazing ultimate and there goes Nasus, a backflip or two, Ryze doing a very good job.
And his next action will be of course handing Hayle, handing Kayle, her helmet back as helmets > damage output.
All the teams of course choosing to group up now. All the five players for each team getting ready for minions to spawn in middle.
You know, that Warwick taking Summoner Revive is of course the best choice, and the tanks in back as this is the 600 Elo showmatch.
Every player just spamming /taunt trying to look as menacing as possible without actually doing anything important.
But there we go Ryze running across the map choosing to do what damage he can with his feet. Jumping up into the air and what will happen next?
Well I don’t know ‘cuz my screen is frozen and I can’t commentate action that I can’t see. But tune in next time when “the cycle of life and death continues.”

title: League of Legends - Season One Cinematic Commentated
